Anyone who makes a mistake or is last to put their hand down takes the entire pile of cards on the table. Some special cards spice up the game.

Name: Loads of Roads
Description:
You are the city planner over a large construction site. Show your friends that you can build the best city by earning the most victory points in 1 year (12 rounds). Earn victory points by gathering resources to construct buildings, catching fish to show sustainability for large populations, utilizing warehouses to create jobs, gathering gold to speed up production, and connecting major roads to complete road plans. Whoever has the most victory points at the end of the 12th month wins the game!

Do you like building things? Are you a creative person? Do you enjoy solving puzzles? Loads of Roads combines the joy of being creative with the satisfaction that comes from solving an intense puzzle. Whether you are a game geek or the casual player, Loads of Roads has something to offer. A beginner will walk away feeling proud of the city they built, while an intense gamer will stay awake at night thinking about their next strategy. It is very easy to learn, but nearly impossible to master because of the clever game setup. No two games will ever be the same.

Name: Lorenzo il Magnifico: Big Box
Description:
Lorenzo il Magnifico - Second Edition is the all-in-one package for Lorenzo il Magnifico, including the base game as well as 5 expansions.

Expansions Included:
- Lorenzo il Magnifico: Houses of Renaissance
- the 24 basic cards of Lorenzo il Magnifico: The Pazzi Conspiracy (but not the 24 KSE cards) 
- Lorenzo Il Magnifico: Promo Visconti/Della Scala
- Lorenzo il Magnifico: New Leaders (Niccolò Machiavelli, Raffaello Sanzio)
- Lorenzo il Magnifico: New Leaders #2 (Carlo VIII, Iacopo Salviati)
Any other promos are not included.
Families: Versions & Editions: Big Box Versions of Individual Games

Name: If you're lost you can look and you will find me // Time after time
Description:
A 2 player game of love and time travel...

You have lived a life of time distorted. The days you live are not in chronological order. One day you might be 5 years old, learning to tie your shoe for the first time. You sleep, and awake the next day as a young adult, at a job you suddenly know (or remember?) how to do.

It’s exciting! Never a dull moment, every sensation feels fresh and new. You get to experience firsts again and again. There is no such thing as monotony.

But recently, your days have all had one thing in common. One person is always there. Even though you are living your relationship out of order, it is clear that you will love this person dearly (or perhaps you already do).

For the first time, you feel a desire to change this time-hopping life of yours and live linearly. You want to experience life with this person, to build and share the same memories together.

So now begins a conscious choice. You have to stabilize, to break free of the chaotic whirlpool of time you have found yourself tossed about it, and find calmer waters. You’re not even sure if it’s possible.

As you drag yourself towards a linear timeline, you can feel it take a toll on your body and mind. You’ve never lived time in order before, can you even handle it?

So many questions, so many unknowns. But what you do know is that you have to try, you really, really want to try. And you can sense that they do too.

Play this game when you want to feel very soft, share emotional intimacy, and maybe cry a little.

"Playing the game"


     On your first turn, flip the card your token is already on face up
     On subsequent turns, move your token to an adjacent (not
     Read the prompt that corresponds to your card, answering the questions it poses
     Note down any affects on your Time Sickness. Some cards will give you Time Sickness, others will heal it. 
     The aim of the game is for both players to move their tokens to the Joker card, stabilizing themselves and gaining the ability to live time linearly.

Name: Admirals:  A Game of Fleet Actions in the Golden Age of Fighting Sail
Description:
Admirals is a game which recreates, in a stylized fashion, the movements and interactions of fleets of sailing warships during the late 17th, 18th, and early 19th centuries. The purpose is to allow the player to take the role of the commander of a fleet of sailing warships and explore the choices and challenges which faced his historical counterpart.

Mechanics of this game are simple enough for a single player to command dozens of ships, while exploring the challenges faced by commanders in controlling a fleet of sailing warships in battle.

Turn sequence:
I. Movement Phase
II. Boarding Phase 
III. Signals Phase 
IV. Repair Phase

–description from the rulebook
Families: History: War of the Austrian Succession
History: War of the Spanish Succession

Name: Ping Pong Slam!
Description:
Ping Pong Slam! is a quick 1-2 player puzzle-card game diving into the frenzied sport of table tennis. With a line of shot cards on the table, players race to figure out which card drops the shot, and the first person to guess correctly scores a point. However, things are not as easy as they may seem, and with four different kinds of shot cards, different paddle orientations, serving boosts, and other modifiers, players are going to have to think on their toes to best their opponent!

Ping Pong Slam! was a participant in the 2021 9-Card Nanogame Print and Play Design Contest, in which it was awarded the following:

2nd Place: Best Two-Player Game
1st Place: Most Innovative Mechanic
1st Place: Best Dexterity Game

—description from the designer

Name: Sokushinbutsu!
Description:
Devote yourself utterly to the way of the buddha, and mummify yourself to help in achieving salvation for all of man-kind!

In this three-phase rummy game, try to collect a combination, discard that combination you just got, then discard all your cards.

Name: So, You've Been Eaten.: Confused Immune System
Description:
The designer of So, You've Been Eaten. created this game as a way to deal with his ongoing Crohn's Disease. In partnership with his editor (LudiCreations), he created a small mini-expansion to raise money that can help fight Crohn's Disease. This is Confused Immune System.

The Confused Immune System is a small mini-expansion, similar in size to Dyspepto-Beastmol. It emulates how an immune system, while necessary to one's health, can overreact and become a burden.

All benefits from this mini-expansion will be donated to Crohn's & Colitis Foundation.

A digestive system can be a complicated space. Most of the times it can take a lot of punishment, but some other times it can overreact. You need to be careful in managing its reactions to your actions. In So, You’ve Been Eaten.: Confused Immune System, the Beast will have to do their best to make sure their autoimmune response is not too aggressive, and the miner will try to agitate things.
There are points up for grabs for the player who can control autoimmune tiles most effectively.

—description from the rulebook
